cab.content: From Viceroy, 3rd June 1919. (Received 3 p.m.)Clear the Line.785 S. Secret. Afghanistan. Following from Roos-Keppel, dated 1st June : " Deputy Commissioner, Kohat, reports 31st May 19 hours, attitude of Ivohat Pass Afridis good. Political Agent, Khyber, reports Tirah quiet except for small parties of Afghan deserters. Mohmands quite quiet and in good mood. Mehtar of Chitral telegraphs from Drosh that he has received news from Mastuj that Kila Chilkan has been reinforced by Afghan soldiers under Hakim, and that 300 men with three guns are approaching Panja. Political Agent, Malakand, suggests that Chilkan is the place north of Baroghil Pass marked (two corrupt groups). All cities and districts quiet. No other news."r
